intro: Euphrasia pseudokerneri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. Euphrasia pseudokerneri is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and healing properties.
